#205

- Growing gregariously (paired but not fused) in open mixed oak/hickory woodland ridge.
- Nearby Trees: Bitternut Hickory, American Hophornbeam, Northern Red Oak, Ash, Chinkapin Oak, Elm, and Black Oak.
- Cap bald with minor rose comb mutation, and sturdy (for a Russula). Pileipellis easily peeling 1/4 to the center.
- Gills sturdy, but brittle.
- Stipe white slightly bruising brownish.
- Smell: Not distinctive.
- Taste: Bitter
- KOH: Slight light yellow on pileipellis, and faintly darkening stipe.
- Ammonia: Negative
- UV: gills fluorescing under 365nm light.
